info.title: Alphaus Blue API reference
info.description:
Alphaus provides an API for interacting with its services. Blue API is a RESTful API that can be accessed by an HTTP client such as `curl`, or any HTTP library which is part of most modern programming languages. This API reference is autogenerated from [protocol buffers](https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers) defined in this [repository](https://github.com/alphauslabs/blueapi), together with our supported [client libraries](https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/sdks/). See the official [documentation](https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/) for more information.

You may encounter the following feature maturity indicators:
- **(BETA)** - New or experimental features, subject to changes; and
- **(Deprecated)** - Outdated or replaced features.

Some endpoints, especially those that return lists of resources, have streaming responses; newline-separated stream of “chunks”. Each chunk is an envelope that can contain either a response message or an error. Only the last chunk will include an error, if any.

tags.name: Operations
tags.description: (BETA) Long operations API. Base URL: https://api.alphaus.cloud/m/blue

get.summary: Lists all account groups.
Gets an account group.
Lists all API clients belonging to the caller.

post.summary: Creates an API client for the caller.

delete.summary: Deletes an API client belonging to the caller.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The client id to delete.

get.summary: Lists all IP filters. At the moment, this API is only available for root users.

post.summary:
Creates an IP filter item for IP blacklisting or whitelisting. At the moment,
this API is only available for root users.

delete.summary: Deletes an IP filter item. At the moment, this API is only available for root users.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The IP filter id to delete.

get.summary:
Lists all permissions based on the input's scope. For reference, supported
permissions can be found on [https://github.com/mobingi/rbac-permissions].

parameters.name: subUser
parameters.description:
Optional. The subuser to query. If empty (default), query all available permissions.
If set to a valid subuser, query that subuser's permissions, if allowed. You can
also set this field to `me` to query your own permissions.

get.summary: Lists all available roles.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Optional. If not set, all roles will be returned.

post.summary:
Creates a role. If your `permissions` list contains an `Admin` entry, all other
entries will be discarded except `Admin`. Roles are root user-level. That means
all roles created by the root user, or any subuser that has permissions to
create roles, are available to all subusers.

delete.summary: Deletes a role. Deleting a role will also remove all mappings.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The parent namespace.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Required. The role name to delete.

put.summary: Updates a role. If role name is different, rename mapped role name.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The new namespace.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Required. The role name to update.

newName.description: Optional. If set, update the current name to this.

permissions.description: Required. The list of permissions to attach to this role.

schema.description: Request message for the Iam.UpdateRole rpc.

get.summary: Lists roles attached to the caller or the input.

parameters.name: subUser
parameters.description: Optional. The subuser to query. Defaults to caller if not set.

post.summary:
Maps roles to a subuser. You can only map (or attach) up to 5 roles to a user per namespace.
There is no limit for filtering rules per user.

put.summary:
Updates user-to-role mappings. You can only map (or attach) up to 5 roles to a user per namespace.
There is no limit for filtering rules per user.

get.summary: Lists all subusers.

post.summary: Creates a subuser.

get.summary:
Gets subuser information. This call includes all of the subuser metadata. See
[https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/] for the list of supported attributes.
If the `{name}` parameter is `me` or `-`, returns the caller information, which
is equivalent to `WhoAmI()` or `GET:/iam/v*/whoami`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The subuser name to delete.

get.summary:
Gets user information about the caller. This call includes all of the user metadata.
See [https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/] for the list of supported attributes.
Lists long-running operations.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: Optional. The name of the operation's parent resource. Not used at the moment.

parameters.name: asOf
parameters.description:
Optional. List operations on and after this date. Format is yyyymmdd. For example,
if you want to list all operations starting from June 01, 2021, set to `20210601`.
If not set, defaults to the first day of the current UTC month.

parameters.name: includeDone
parameters.description:
Optional. If true, include all operations that are marked as done. Exclude by
default.

get.summary:
Gets the latest state of a long-running operation. You can use this method to
poll the operation result at intervals.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the operation resource.

delete.summary:
Deletes a long-running operation. This method indicates that the client is no
longer interested in the operation result. It does not cancel the operation.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the operation resource to be deleted.

post.summary:
Starts asynchronous cancellation on a long-running operation. The server makes
a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed. On successful
cancellation, the operation is not deleted; instead, it becomes an operation with
a value of [google.rpc.Status.code][google.rpc.Status.code] 1, corresponding
to `Code.CANCELLED`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the operation resource to be cancelled.

schema.description: Request message for the Operations.CancelOperation rpc.

get.summary: Gets information about the caller's organization.

post.summary: Creates the organization account.

put.summary:
Updates organization metadata. See [https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/]
for the list of supported attributes.

post.summary:
Sends (or resends) the verification email. Only valid for unverified
organizations. The verification key will be valid for a day.

Verifies an organization using the key received from the verification email.
The verification key is only valid for a day.

get.summary: Gets current preferences.

post.summary: Writes a new (or update an existing) key:value data in your store.

Initiates an ondemand import of all registered CUR files. See
[https://help.alphaus.cloud/en/articles/3612555-ripple-aws-things-you-need-to-prepare-before-starting]
for more information.

get.summary: Lists all billing groups.

post.summary: Registers a billing group.

get.summary: Gets a billing group.
Scans key:value data from your store.

parameters.name: like
parameters.description:
Optional. If non-empty, translates to SQL's `LIKE` operand.
Return all keys by default.

get.summary: Reads a key:value data from your store.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Required. The key to read.

delete.summary: Deletes a key:value data from your store.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description:
Required. The key to delete. To delete all keys, set this to `-` (hyphen).
You can also prefix this with `like:` which translates to SQL's LIKE operator.
For example, `like:%pattern%`.

get.summary: Lists all vendor accounts.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

post.summary: Registers a vendor account.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

id.description: Required. The account id to register.

name.description: Optional. If empty, set to the value of `id`.

parent.description:
Optional. The parent `billingInternalId` of the billing group to which this account
will belong to.

awsOptions.description: Required for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

schema.description: Request message for the Cost.CreateAccount rpc.

get.summary:
Gets a vendor account. This API includes all of the account's metadata. See
https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/ for the list of supported attributes.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The account id to retrieve.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The account id to delete.

post.summary:
Reads the non-usage-based details of an organization (Ripple) or billing group (Wave).
This API covers non-usage-based adjustments, such as Fees, Credits, Discounts, Tax,
Upfront Fees, etc. At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 'aws'. If datetime
range parameters are not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

groupId.description:
Optional. At the moment, only billing internal ids are supported. If set, reads the
non-usage-based adjustment details of this group. Valid only if `accountId` is not set.
If both `groupId` and `accountId` are not set, reads the adjustment details of the whole
organization. Only valid for Ripple users. Implied (or discarded) for Wave(Pro) users.

accountId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the non-usaged-based adjustment details of this account. Also
invalidates the `billingInternalId` value even if set. If both `billingInternalId`
and `accountId` are not set, reads the adjustment details of the whole organization.

startTime.description:
Optional. The UTC date to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the
current month will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

endTime.description:
Optional. The UTC date to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be
used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

awsOptions.description: Optional. Valid only for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

schema.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadAdjustments rpc.

delete.summary: Removes monthly budget for the account/acctgroup id from database.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: budgetId
parameters.description: Required. Budget Id

put.summary: Updates monthly budget for the account/acctgroup id.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: budgetId
parameters.description: Required. Budget Id

get.summary: Fetches monthly budget for the account/acctgroup id.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. 'account' or 'acctgroup'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. Account or AccountGroup Id

parameters.name: year
parameters.description:
Optional. Default is current year
Format: yyyy.

post.summary: Creates monthly budget for the account/acctgroup id.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. 'account' or 'acctgroup'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. Account or AccountGroup Id

get.summary: Lists vendor costs calculations history and statuses.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: asOf
parameters.description:
Optional. List operations on and after this date. Format is yyyymmdd. For example,
if you want to list all operations starting from June 01, 2021, set to `20210601`.
If not set, defaults to the first day of the current UTC month.

parameters.name: excludeDone
parameters.description:
Optional. If true, exclude all operations that are marked as done. Include by
default.

get.summary: WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Gets the vendor cost calculator's current configuration.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

get.summary: WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Gets the vendor cost calculator's current status.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

post.summary:
Triggers monthly calculations for costs and invoices at either organization or billing group level.
For the AWS calculator, aggregation is done at daily and monthly level. Also, all occurrences of the
character `|` (pipe) in the CUR descriptions and tag key/values are replaced with the `/` (forward-slash)
character. This is due to the `|` character having a special designation in the data processing workflows.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

groupId.description:
Optional. If set to a particular billing group, calculate for that billing group.
If empty, calculate for all billing groups.

At the moment, for AWS, this is only valid for account type billing groups, not
tag billing groups. If a tag billing group is provided, it is discarded and the
calculation is done for the whole organization.

month.description:
Optional. The UTC month to calculate. If empty, it defaults to the previous month.
Format is `yyyymm`. For example, June 2021 will be `202106`.

awsOptions.description: Optional. Valid only for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

schema.description: Request message for the Cost.CalculateCosts rpc.

post.summary:
Reads the usage-based cost details of an organization (Ripple) or billing group (Wave).
At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 'aws'. If datetime range parameters are
not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

groupId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the usage-based cost details of this group. Only valid for Ripple
users. Implied as the parent billing group for Wave(Pro) users.

For AWS Ripple, only billing internal ids are supported at the moment. Overriden when
`accountId` is set to anything other than `*`. Set this and `accountId` to `*` to read
the usage-based cost details of the whole organization. Optional for AWS Wave(Pro).

accountId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the usage-based cost details of this account.

For AWS, setting this will override `groupId`. Set this and `groupId` to `*` to read the
usage-based cost details of the whole organization.

startTime.description:
Optional. The UTC date to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the
current month will be used. Format: yyyymmdd.

endTime.description:
Optional. The UTC date to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be
used. Format: `yyyymmd`.

awsOptions.description: Optional. Valid only for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

schema.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadCosts rpc.

get.summary:
Fetches cost forecasts for the specified billing group.
Includes historical cost (up to previous month) and forecasted cost (up to three months for now).

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description:
Optional. Company Id of Billing Group to retrieve.
Default value is user's Company Id.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description:
Optional. Forecast frequency. Valid values are `daily` and `monthly`. 
Default value is `daily`.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description:
Optional. Forecast granularity. Valid values are `account`, `category` and `product`.
Default value is `account`.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description:
Optional. Start date to get cost forecast. 
If from_date is less than current date, historical costs are included.
If from_date is greater than current date, only forecasted costs are returned.
Format: `yyyy-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description:
Optional. End date to get cost forecast. 
Currently, we only support 90 days forecasting from the first day of current month.
Format: `yyyy-mm-dd`.

get.summary: Fetches previous month cost vs current month forecast vs current accumulated cost per category for id.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. 'account' or 'acctgroup'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. Account or AccountGroup Id

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
Optional. Default is current month. 
Format: yyyymm.

get.summary: Fetches current month daily forecast vs current accumulated daily cost for id.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. 'account' or 'acctgroup'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. Account or AccountGroup Id

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
Optional. Default is current month. 
Format: yyyymm.

get.summary: Fetches monthly accumulated costs vs forecasted cost vs budget for the id.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. 'account' or 'acctgroup'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. Account or AccountGroup Id

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description:
Optional. Start month to get cost forecast. 
Format: `yyyymm`.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description:
Optional. Last month to get cost forecast. 
Format: `yyyymm`.

post.summary:
Reads the usage-based non tag costs of a billing group. At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 
'aws'. If datetime range parameters are not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

billingInternalId.description: Required. The billing internal id to stream.

startTime.description:
Optional. Timestamp to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the
current month will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

endTime.description:
Optional. Timestamp to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be used.
Format: `yyyymmdd`.

groupByMonths.description:
Optional. Group services and costs by months in the range of `startTime` and `endTime`.
If not set, daily data will be returned.

schema.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadNonTagCosts rpc.

get.summary:
Lists vendor payer accounts. For AWS, these are management accounts (formerly known
as master or payer accounts); for Azure, these are subscriptions, for GCP, these
are projects.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

post.summary: Registers a vendor payer account.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

awsOptions.description: Required for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

schema.description: Request message for the Cost.CreatePayerAccount rpc.

get.summary:
Gets a vendor payer account. This API includes all of the account's metadata.
See https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/ for the list of supported attributes.
For AWS, this means a management account (formerly known as master or payer account);
for Azure, this means a subscription, for GCP, this means a project.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The id of the account to get.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The id of the account.

get.summary:
Gets a payer account's import history, which is a list of timestamps our system tracks when the account's data are
imported to our system, which in turn, triggers processing. At the moment, this only supports AWS (CUR files).
You can also set {id} to `*` to return all payers' information under the organization.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The account id to query. Could be `*`, which implies all payers.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description:
Optional. The UTC month to query. If empty, defaults to current month.
Format is `yyyymm`. For example, June 2021 will be `202106`.

post.summary: WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Get cost opmtimization recommendations for an organization (or MSP).

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Required. Organization Id.

post.summary: WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Get cost reduction details for an organization (or MSP).

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Required. Organization Id.

period.description:
Optional. The month to display the cost reduction details. If not set,
month-to-date will be used. Format: yyyymm.

post.summary:
Reads the usage-based tag costs of a billing group. At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 
'aws'. If datetime range parameters are not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

billingInternalId.description: Required. The billing internal id to stream.

startTime.description:
Optional. Timestamp to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the
current month will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

endTime.description:
Optional. Timestamp to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be used.
Format: `yyyymmdd`.

groupByMonths.description:
Optional. Group services and costs by months in the range of `startTime` and `endTime`.
If not set, daily data will be returned.

awsOptions.description: Optional. Valid only for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

schema.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadTagCosts rpc.

metadata.description: The attributes (key/value pair) of the account.
The attributes (key/value pair) of the AccountGroup.

clientSecret.description: API client secret. Only available during creation; otherwise, redacted.

parent.description:
The user's parent. If empty or non-existent, it means this user is a root user;
otherwise, it's a subuser.

metadata.description:
The attributes (key/value pair) of the user. If hierarchy is supported, it will be
separated by '/', such as 'key/subkey=value'. See https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/
for the list of supported attributes.

adjustmentsTypeList.description: CUR lineitem types included in Ripple's 'Adjusting Entries'.

excludedServicesFromUsage.description:
List of services that are of type 'Usage' in CUR that are excluded,
optionally converted to Adjustments.

lastMonthlyRun.description:
Timestamp in UTC of the last completed calculation at org level for a given month.
Key is month in `yyyy-mm` format, value is timestamp in RFC3339 format.

isRunning.description:
Whether the calculator is still running for a given month.
Key is month in `yyyy-mm` format, value is true or false.

groupId.description: The group id the account is associated with during the query.

date.description: For daily data, format is yyyy-mm-dd; for monthly, yyyy-mm.

resourceId.description: At the moment, this is not yet supported, always empty.

usage.description:
Only set when all columns are specified. Any type of grouping will set
this value to zero.

cost.description: The true cost (calculated) for this lineitem.

unblendedCost.description: The unblended cost as reflected in the CUR for this lineitem.

baseCurrency.description:
The base currency for cost, unblendedCost, effectiveCost, amortizedCost.
Always set to USD, CUR's default currency.

exchangeRate.description: The exchange rate used to convert baseCurrency to targetCurrency.

managementAccount.description: The management account (formerly master account) the `productCode` belongs to.

convertedToAdjustments.description: If the product code is converted to Adjustments or not.

metadata.description:
Service-specific metadata associated with the operation. It typically
contains progress information and common metadata such as create time.
Some services might not provide such metadata. Any method that returns a
long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

done.description:
If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress.
If `true`, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is
available.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

response.description:
The normal response of the operation in case of success. If the original method returns
no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is `google.protobuf.Empty`. If the
original method is standard `Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the
resource. For other methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where
`Xxx` is the original method name. For example, if the original method name is
`TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is `TakeSnapshotResponse`.

blueapiapiOperation.description:
This resource represents a long-running operation that is the result of a
network API call.

typeUrl.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

name.description: The unique name (or id) of the organization.

email.description: The registered email of the organization.

metadata.description:
The metadata (key/value pair) of the organization. If hierarchy is supported, it will be
separated by '/', such as 'metakey/subkey=value'. See https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/
for the list of supported attributes.

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

force.description:
Optional. If set to true, discard existing calculation operation(s), if any, and
make this as the active/latest one. By default, if there is an ongoing operation
during the call, the request will fail.

accountsOnly.description:
Optional. If set to true, only calculate for account-type billing groups. If both
`accountsOnly` and `tagsOnly` are set to true, `accountsOnly` will prevail.

tagsOnly.description:
Optional. If set to true, only calculate for tags-type billing groups. Discarded
when the organization doesn't have any tag-based billing groups configured. If
both `accountsOnly` and `tagsOnly` are set to true, `accountsOnly` will prevail.

v1CostItem.description: Response message wrapper for cloud costs.

managementAccountId.description:
Optional. The management account id (formerly known as master, or payer) to
which an account belongs to, initially. If the account is moved to another
management account, the system is able to detect it and set this value
accordingly.

v1CreateAccountRequestAwsOptions.description: AWS-specific options for registering an account.

name.description: Required. The descriptive name of the API client to create.

v1CreateApiClientRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateApiClient rpc.

billingTitle.title: Optional. The title of the billing

remarks.title: Optional. Any remarks about the billing group

displayCost.title: Optional. Calculation type, true unblended or unblended

exchangeRateType.title: Optional. Exchange rate type, payer or billing group

v1CreateBillingGroupRequest.description: Request message for the Billing.CreateBillingGroup rpc.

value.description:
Required. The IP input to filter, either blacklist or whitelist. Should be in
CIDR format (i.e. 1.2.3.4/32).

type.description: Optional. Can be `whitelist` or `blacklist`. Defaults to `blacklist` if empty.

rootUser.description:
Optional. If `rootUser` is valid and `subUser` is empty, filter is for this rootuser.
If both `rootUser` and `subUser` inputs are empty, filter is at global scope.

subUser.description:
Optional. If `subuser` is valid, filter is for this subuser; `rootUser` value is discarded.
If both `rootUser` and `subUser` inputs are empty, filter is at global scope.

v1CreateIpFilterRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateIpFilter rpc.

description.title: Required. Organization's description or company name

password.description: Optional. User can decide to let the system generates the password.

v1CreateOrgRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.CreateOrg rpc.

v1CreateOrgResponse.description: Response message for the Organization.CreateOrg rpc.

id.description: Required. The id of the management account.

name.description:
Optional. The name, or description of the management account.
This is set to `id` when not specified.

roleArn.description: Required. Role ARN for Alphaus to assume for access.

v1CreatePayerAccountRequestAwsOptions.description:
See [https://help.alphaus.cloud/en/articles/3612555-ripple-aws-things-you-need-to-prepare-before-starting]
for more information.
See [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cur/latest/userguide/cur-create.html] for more information.
Requirements include: Additional report details = 'Include Resource IDS' enabled,
Prefix = non-empty (recommendation only), Time granularity = 'Hourly', File format = 'text/csv'.

name.description:
Required. The name of the role to create. Role names should have at least 6
characters in length and 32 characters maximum. It should also be alphanumeric.
Hyphens and underscores are allowed in between. The regular expression used
for validation is `^[A-Za-z0-9][A-Za-z0-9_-]*[A-Za-z0-9]$`.

namespace.description: Required. The namespace where this role will belong.

permissions.description: Required. The list of permissions to attach to this role.

v1CreateRoleRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateRole rpc.

name.description:
Required. Min: 4, max: 18, allowed characters: letters, numbers, `_` (underscore),
`.` (period) and `-` (hyphen) characters.

email.description: Optional. Email address of the subuser.

nickName.description: Optional. Nickname or description. It is set to 'name' if empty.

v1CreateUserRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateUser rpc.

subUser.description: Optional. The subuser to map the roles. Defaults to caller if not set.

roles.description: Required. The roles to map to the user. Limited to 5 items.

v1CreateUserRoleMappingRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateUserRoleMapping rpc.

v1CreateUserRoleMappingResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.CreateUserRoleMapping rpc.

v1GetAccountGroupResponse.description: Response message for the Admin.GetAccountGroup rpc.

v1GetBillingGroupResponse.description: Response message for the Billing.GetBillingGroup rpc.

v1GetCalculatorConfigResponse.description: Response message for the Cost.GetCalculatorConfig rpc.

v1GetCalculatorStatusResponse.description: Response message for the Cost.GetCalculatorStatus rpc.

v1GetForecastsResponse.description: Response message for GetForecasts per billing group.

timestamps.title:
List of timestamps in RFC3339 format with the `T` separator.
Example: `2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z`

v1GetPayerAccountImportHistoryResponse.description: Response message for the Cost.GetPayerAccountImportHistory rpc.

recommendationType.description:
Required. Valid values: 'reservation', 'rightsizing', 'scheduling'
Only 'reservation' is supported for now.

type.title:
For recommendationType = 'reservation'
Optional. Valid values: 'combined', 'individual'
Default: 'combined'

services.title:
For recommendationType = 'reservation'
Optional. List of Services
Default: All services with Reserved Instance or Savings Plan

term.title:
For recommendationType = 'reservation'
Optional. Valid values: '1yr', '3yr'
Default: '1yr'

offeringClass.title:
For recommendationType = 'reservation'
Optional. Valid values: 'standard', 'convertible'
Default: 'standard'

paymentOption.title:
For recommendationType = 'reservation'
Optional. Valid values: 'allUpfront', 'partialUpfront', 'noUpfront'
Default: 'allUpfront'

tenancy.title:
For recommendationType = 'reservation'
Optional. Valid values: 'shared', 'dedicated'
Default: 'shared'

riCoverage.title:
For recommendationType = 'reservation'
Optional. Percentage of the usage (in NormalizedUnits) to be covered by Reserved Instance
Default: 100

spCoverage.title:
For recommendationType = 'reservation'
Optional. Percentage of the usage (in NormalizedUnits) to be covered by Savings Plan
Default: 100 - riCoverage

month.description:
Optional. The UTC month to import. If empty, it defaults to the current month.
Format is `yyyymm`. For example, June 2021 will be `202106`.

filter.description:
Optional. A comma-separated list of management accounts to import. If empty,
all CURs associated with all your management accounts will be imported.

v1ImportCurFilesRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.ImportCurFiles rpc.

id.description:
IP filter item id. Note that this name is transcient and is not fixed. However,
you can use any of its permutations to endpoints that accept it, such as
the `DELETE:/iam/v?/ipfilters/{id}` endpoint, without issues.

target.description:
The target of the filter. If global scope, this is usually empty.
Rootuser name for rootuser scope, and subuser name for subuser scope.
For subuser targets, format is `rootuser/subuser`.

type.description: The type of IP filter. It could be `whitelist` or `blacklist`.

value.description: The IP filter value. Should be in CIDR format.

v1ListAccountGroupsResponse.description: Response message for the Admin.ListAccountGroups rpc.

v1ListCalculationsHistoryAwsResponse.description:
AWS-specific response message for the Cost.ListCalculationsHistory rpc. Should be
compatible with the Operations API.

v1ListCalculationsHistoryResponse.description: Response message for the Cost.ListCalculationsHistory rpc.

v1ListPermissionsResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.ListPermissions rpc.

v1ListRolesResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.ListRoles rpc.

v1ListUserRoleMappingsResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.ListUserRoleMappings rpc.

toCurrency.description:
Optional. Set to US dollars (USD) by default (AWS CUR's default currency). You can
set it to the desired three-letter currency symbol (i.e. JPY, EUR, GBP), in which
case, it will use the latest exchange rates provided by https://fixer.io. If you
prefer a custom exchange rate, you can append the rate to the currency's three-letter
symbol. For example, `JPY:110.622` for the Japanese Yen. Note that the exchange rate
should be against the US dollar (USD).

groupByColumns.description:
Optional. A comma-separated list of columns to aggregate the data into. Valid values
are `productCode`, `serviceCode`, `region`, `zone`, `usageType`, `instanceType`,
`operation`, `invoiceId`, `description`, and `resourceId`. A special value of `none`
is also supported, which means no additional columns will be queried, which translates
to data aggregated daily (or monthly, see `groupByMonth`) per account.

For example, if you only want the services and region data, you can set this field to
`productCode,region`. Your input sequence doesn't matter (although the sequence above
is recommended) as the actual sequence is already fixed in the return data (see the
definition in https://github.com/alphauslabs/blueapi/blob/main/api/aws/cost.proto),
which is generic to specific, top to bottom. Invalid values are discarded. Excluded
columns will be empty.

groupByMonth.description:
Optional. If set to true, return data grouped by month. At the moment, it only supports
`productCode` column when enabled; meaning, costs per account per service per month.
If you want data that is grouped per account per month, set this to `true`, then set
`groupByColumns` to `none`.

filters.description:
Optional. A list of filtering options. See [ReadCostsRequestAwsOptionsFilters] for more
information on each filter item. Multiple filter items will use the logical 'or' operator,
e.g. filter1 || filter2 || filter3, etc.

includeTags.description:
Optional. If set to true, stream will include resource tags. Discarded when
`groupByColumns` field is set.

includeCostCategories.description:
Optional. If set to true, stream will include resource cost category information.
Discarded when `groupByColumns` field is set.

toCurrency.description:
Optional. Set to US dollars (USD) by default (AWS CUR's default currency). You can
set it to the desired three-letter currency symbol (i.e. JPY, EUR, GBP), in which
case, it will use the latest exchange rates provided by https://fixer.io. If you
prefer a custom exchange rate, you can append the rate to the currency's three-letter
symbol. For example, `JPY:110.622` for the Japanese Yen. Note that the exchange rate
should be against the US dollar (USD).

forceLatest.description:
Optional. If set to true, always get the up-to-date calculation results. This data
isn't necessarily in-sync with your invoice data as AWS could still have updated your
CUR files even after you created your invoices. By default, returned data are those
that are always in-sync with your invoices.

This field is discarded for Wave(Pro) users. You will always get the latest data that
is in-sync with your invoices.

v1ReadCostsRequestAwsOptionsFilters.description:
A map of "key:value" column filters. Dependent on `groupByColumns` and/or `groupByMonth`.
The key indicates the column name while the value is the filter value prefixed by either
"eq:" (equal), "re:" (regular expressions based on https://github.com/google/re2), or
"!re:" (reverse "re:"). Multiple map items will use the logical 'and' operator, e.g.
mapfilter1 && mapfilter2 && mapfilter3, etc.

For example, if you like to filter `productCode` to return only `AmazonEC2`, set to
`{"productCode":"eq:AmazonEC2"}`. You can also use a regular expression like 
`{"productCode":"re:AmazonEC2|AmazonRDS"}`, which means return all AmazonEC2 or AmazonRDS
lineitems. Or reverse regexp, such as `{"productCode":"!re:^AmazonEC2$"}`, which means
return all items except `AmazonEC2`.

tagId.description: Optional. If set, only return data for this tagId.

v1UpdateMetadataRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.UpdateMetadata rpc.

v1UpdatePasswordRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.UpdatePassword rpc.

subUser.description: Optional. The subuser to map the roles. Defaults to caller if not set.

roles.description:
Required. The roles to map to the user. Limited to 5 items. Setting `role` to
empty will remove the mapping.

v1UpdateUserRoleMappingRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.UpdateUserRoleMapping rpc.

v1UpdateUserRoleMappingResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.UpdateUserRoleMapping rpc.

v1VerifyOrgRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.VerifyOrg rpc.
